body_html:
I looked through the changes and I think I know what the issue is.
All ops registered in core are exported by default in core TensorFlow. For e.g. ApplyAdaMax would be available as tf.apply_ada_max. This is causing a diff in api_compatibility_test.
If you don't want to make these ops available in core, then you can set visibility: HIDDEN in the api_def_*.pbtxt files.

You can add "visibility: HIDDEN" after graph_op_name, for e.g.:
op {
graph_op_name: "ApplyAdaMax"
visibility: HIDDEN
...

If you don't want to make these ops available in core, then you can set visibility: HIDDEN in the api_def_*.pbtxt files.
You can add "visibility: HIDDEN" after graph_op_name, for e.g.:
op {
graph_op_name: "ApplyAdaMax"
visibility: HIDDEN
...
body:
I looked through the changes and I think I know what the issue is.
All ops registered in core are exported by default in core TensorFlow. For e.g. ApplyAdaMax would be available as tf.apply_ada_max. This is causing a diff in api_compatibility_test.
If you don't want to make these ops available in core, then you can set visibility: HIDDEN in the api_def_*.pbtxt files.

You can add "visibility: HIDDEN" after graph_op_name, for e.g.:
op {
  graph_op_name: "ApplyAdaMax"
  visibility: HIDDEN
  ...
